author: Natethegreat101
title: Terrific Trading With a Terrible Trader
review:
While the set is pretty basic in terms of construction, I must say that all the colors used makes this set very enjoyable to put together. The final result is quite eye catching as well. The colorful background is of course accurate to the source material, as this set is meant to be in a mesa/badlands biome- complete with the start of an abandoned mineshaft.

The namesake trading post is effectively done making use of the wandering trader's general colors. A neat little feature to the build is that the table for trading items actually flips- a very effective way to represent the trading post being closed.

A simple 2 piece tnt play feature is hidden into the abandoned mineshaft to clear the mineshaft rail tracks.

As for the parts, the two notable inclusions are:

  • 4 Dark Orange 6x6 Plate 
  • 2 Dark Blue Flat Tile 2x2 Inverted

The trader lamas also have exclusive prints to them and use a new mold for their face. The face also makes use of a 1x1 plate and a printed 1x1 tile for the mouth. The lamas are excellent and accurate to the source material, which is funny to me because....

The wandering trader figure itself is all wrong. The figure should have had an additional layer of red pixels surrounding the face and the torso printing should have used red printing on the torso instead of the reddish brown used. As the figure is, it's ok for what it is, but it is quite awkward when compared to the lamas. I don't quite understand how the designer missed this, as both the lamas and even the trading post structure make use of red!

Overall, this is a great little Minecraft set- as long as you can get past the inaccurate wandering trader figure.

author: Kiiranaux
title: Two great MC vinettes in one cute set
review:
The Trading Post is a great little set that combines two vinettes into one convenient scene.

The scene takes place in a Mesa biome. A Wandering Trader has set up shop and unhauled wares from his two Llamas; Steve spies the shop while emerging from a blocked-up Mineshaft, pursued by a Skeleton.

Overall / Playability / Value : Higher than other Minecraft sets

Parts: Good for a Minecraft set (due to unique minifigures, Llamas, and Mesa-colored pieces)

Building Experience: About average for a Minecraft set, with 1 standard working catapult.

Pros:

The Mesa biome is beautifully constructed using shades of red, yellow, and brown, and provides a reasonable amount of parts to recreate this biome using your own ideas.

The new trader minifigure and llamas are a great addition to the lineup

The two vinettes are really quite separate, so there's double the potential for your scenes.

Cons:

Llama nose pieces are printed poorly; luckily you get a spare of each one

There's nothing really new in the Mineshaft vinette to merit its inclusion; however this was probably necessary to sell three new mini/animal figures at $20, and pays for itself by providing great Mesa colored pieces.

Improvements:

The only change I would have made to this set would be the addition of a chest for the trader, perhaps with other options for sale like an Ender Pearl or Seeds.

Recommendation:

Must-buy for play, parts, panorama
